Crab Game is a free multiplayer ‚Äúparty‚Äù game where you and 30 strangers politely cooperate to‚Äî
just kidding, you scream into proximity chat and throw each other off platforms for internet points.

Imagine kids‚Äô playground games, but:

* there are no teachers,
* fall damage is lethal,
* and everyone has discovered the shove button.

---

### Pros

* **Completely free**, which is good, because you‚Äôre mostly paying with sanity.
* Proximity chat turns every lobby into a social experiment the Geneva Convention wouldn‚Äôt approve of.
* Lots of mini-games:

  * Red light/green light but with physics
  * Floor is lava but with betrayal
  * King of the hill but with tax-evader energy
* Spectating is somehow *more* entertaining than playing: watching 2 brain cells duel on an icy platform is peak esports.
* Perfect game to instantly find out which of your friends is secretly a backstabbing gremlin.

---

### Cons

* Public lobbies are 50% memes, 50% microphone war crimes. Mute button is not optional.
* You will die to someone gently touching you at Mach 3 from behind.
* ‚ÄúTeamwork‚Äù lasts exactly until there are fewer than 4 players left, then it becomes a nature documentary.
* Host leaves ‚Üí entire server Thanos-snaps out of existence. Your victory? Gone. Your dignity? Also gone.

---

### Peak Crab Game Moments

* Making an alliance with three people, then all four of you immediately pushing each other off a cliff anyway.
* Surviving an entire round just by standing very still and radiating prey energy.
* Getting eliminated in the first 5 seconds, then shouting ‚ÄúEZ‚Äù from spectator mode like a true gamer.
* Winning a lobby and realizing your prize was‚Ä¶ absolutely nothing except the knowledge you‚Äôre worse than your enemies morally.

---

9/10
Party game, social test, psychological horror‚Äîdepends on the lobby.

Would get shoved into the void by a 12-year-old with a $5 headset and queue up ‚Äúone more‚Äù again.
this game changed my life, the high octane gameplay, the calm visauls, the competitive gameplay, a white tear ran down my leg , and my favourite p[art is when you get silently put to sleep

I fully expected this to be a low-effort meme game cranked out quickly to capitalize on a popular trend, but it's actually a legitimately very fun party game that play surprisingly well on Steam Deck with whatever default community control setup it picked. I set my mouse sensitifity to 120 and still managed to be surprisingly competetive in things like the snowball fight game. Map designs are actually pretty good in the games where they matter

Crab Game is chaotic fun!
It‚Äôs like Squid Game, but way sillier and more unpredictable.
Jumping, running, and trying not to die never felt this hilarious.
8.5/10 ‚Äì perfect for a quick laugh with friends :laughing:

A simple multiplayer game to enjoy with friends. It really needs an update with new games, especially now that Squid Game has seasons 2 and 3.

Imagine Squid Game, but everyone‚Äôs microphone is permanently set to max volume, half the lobby is screaming ‚ÄúSTOP PUSHING ME,‚Äù and the other half is blasting cursed soundboard clips. That‚Äôs Crab Game.

The gameplay is simple: mini-games where you jump, run, push, and betray your friends. The execution? Absolute chaos. Every round turns into a mix of laughter, rage, and betrayal as people backstab each other to survive. You‚Äôll win one game by pure luck, then lose the next because your ‚Äúfriend‚Äù shoved you into lava while giggling.

Pros:

Free (your wallet survives, but your sanity doesn‚Äôt)

Peak comedy when played with friends (or randoms if you like suffering)

Easy to pick up, impossible to play without laughing

Physics + voice chat = chaos engine

Cons:

Voice chat is basically a war crime

Very unbalanced, but that‚Äôs the fun

You will lose friends

Final Verdict:
It‚Äôs stupid. It‚Äôs loud. It‚Äôs broken. And it‚Äôs one of the funniest multiplayer experiences you‚Äôll ever have. Thanks Dani.
Free chaos, mini-games, and endless laughs. Perfect for trolling friends or getting trolled.
Is free to play and still has an active community behind it. Its much better with voice chat.

Crab Game is a chaotic, multiplayer party game inspired by ‚ÄúSquid Game.‚Äù The matches are fast-paced, silly, and often hilariously unpredictable. It‚Äôs all about competing with friends (or strangers) in a series of mini-games where anything can happen.

Pros:

Fun and chaotic gameplay that‚Äôs easy to jump into.

Perfect for multiplayer‚Äîso many laughs with friends.

Mini-games are varied and unpredictable, keeping matches exciting.

Lightweight and free, so anyone can try it.

Cons:

Can be buggy or glitchy at times.

Limited single-player content; best enjoyed with others.

Some mini-games can feel repetitive after a while.

Graphics are basic, but the chaos more than makes up for it.

Overall:
Crab Game is pure, silly fun for short, chaotic multiplayer sessions. It‚Äôs not about deep mechanics or story‚Äîit‚Äôs about laughing, trolling, and surviving each round. If you love fast, unpredictable party games with friends, this one‚Äôs a must-play.

This game is absolutely perfect if you want to make your own life miserable! Here's how, in a few simple steps:
1): Launch the game!
2): Join a server!
3): Say a peep, push someone else as part of being competitive, do something!
4): BE SUBJECT TO VOICE SPAM OF "N-WORD" (10X) and "STFU" (10X) AND THEN SOME MORE "N-WORD" (100X) AND "STFU" (100X), OH AND DID I MENTION PREPARE YOUR EARS FOR "N-WORD" (1,000,000X) AND "STFU" (1,000,000X)
5): CUE THE NUCLEAR BOMB MEME!
6): CONGRATULATIONS!
This game gets a solid 10/10. If you ever wanted to make enemies you don't intend, THIS GAME IS FOR YOU!
